channel.title: DS3 Services on 0x000216
channel.description: Recent content in DS3 Services on 0x000216

item.title: DS3 Services Proliferate
item.description: The increasing need for bandwidth in the business world has driven the rapid expansion of high-speed voice and data services. While T1 lines were once considered high-end, businesses now have a variety of options, including various DSx copper and fiber optic connections, wireless broadband, and even point-to-point laser technology. DS3 is gaining popularity as companies find their T1 connections inadequate. Upgrading from a DS1’s 1.5 Mbps to DS3’s 45 Mbps accommodates more users and allows for dedicated internet connections.

item.title: Ethernet over Copper Reviving The Local Loop
item.description: Local loop usage has decreased as people switch from traditional phone lines to wireless or internet-based phone services. This has prompted some to suggest that these copper lines be completely removed. However, just as this idea emerges, new technology is giving these old lines a new purpose. Fiber optic connections may be the future, but theyâ€™re not widely available yet. Only a small percentage of businesses currently have fiber, due to lack of demand, high installation costs, or limited infrastructure.
